newsitem.title: UK: Lloyds up further amid upbeat comment.
newsitem.headline: Lloyds up further amid upbeat comment.

text.p: Shares in banking group Lloyds TSB Group Plc hit the latest of a series of record highs on Monday amid positive press and analyst comment following results on Friday.

Lloyds shares were up 8-1/2p at 744-1/2 by 0954 GMT, after earlier reaching a record 756p -- surpassing its previous peak of 745p on August 1. At today's high, the stock was 75 percent above its level at the end of 1996.

SocGen and BZW were among brokerages which set a price target of 900p on Lloyds shares, after the company on Friday posted a 33 percent rise in pre-tax profit to 1.504 billion stg and said it was planning an acquistion or share buyback.

The Financial Times Lex column said it was possible to come up with a price of more than 900p using discounted cash flow calculations because of Lloyds' strong cash generation and competitive cost base.
Lex added that Lloyd's strong retail position offered protection from margin pressure.
BZW repeated a "buy" rating on the stock and raised its 1997 pre-tax profit estimate to 3.19 billion stg from 3.17 billion. Analysts at the brokerage were not immediately available for comment.

However, Goldman Sachs issued one of the few cautious comments, repeating a "market underperformer" rating even as it raised its pre-tax estimate by five percent to 3.2 billion stg and its 1998 estimate by ten percent to 3.8 billion.
Goldman analysts also could not immediately be reached for comment.
